text: the american kobe burger left me unsatisfied as it seemed to be cooked unevenly and lacked juiciness the excessive presence of lettuce tomato and onion overshadowed the solitary pickle in my opinion paying 17 dollars for this burger was not worthwhile

its great how this mexican restaurant consistently offers highquality food at affordable prices allowing customers to enjoy dishes like a rib eye steak with shrimp without spending too much money and their cleanliness is impeccable
its a good alternative to starbucks but the taste isnt that much different the guy with the weird ponytail not the owner is kinda annoying though
you can have a great time exploring the four levels of the store but be prepared for the steep prices
the relatively expensive cost of the steak seems unjustified considering its average taste however its strategic placement next to the theater might be the reason behind its popularity
the bar serves refreshing beer plays enjoyable music has friendly staff and offers tasty food while it may not be gourmet the flavors are satisfying i particularly enjoyed their fish tacos
love thai food  love this place  they deliver too
was it a good idea to visit grimaldis

i recently had an exceptionally dull burger lacking any taste unusually i had to resort to using salt and pepper to make it somewhat enjoyable which is not my usual practice furthermore the ribs promoted as the highlight of the days menu were unbearable the texture resembled rubber and the accompanying cold bbq sauce only made matters worse

im not particularly fond of this establishment due to their use of sweet pickles on the burgers and their unsatisfactory barbecue sauce i prefer other burger places that offer better value as this one tends to be pricey

my enthusiasm for this place is lacking primarily owing to their choice of sweet pickles on the burgers and the unimpressive barbecue sauce to get better value for my money i tend to favor alternative burger establishments over this relatively expensive one
the price is pretty high considering the mediocre steak seems to be in good business perhaps because it is beside the theater

for over a year i used to walk past this establishment but didnt give it a chance until recently and boy was i pleasantly surprised the quality of the food here is topnotch specifically i got myself some chicken teriyaki skewers alongside a scrumptious rice bowl featuring both beef and chicken honestly if you happen to be in the strip this spot comes highly recommended from me as a mustvisit destination

it is possible that the show i attended in las vegas could be the most remarkable one ever the tickets were undoubtedly worth every penny and there may be tickets available for tonights show so keep an eye out for them this captivating variety show is truly astonishing and i have no doubt that i will be watching it again
the food has great potential but its unfortunate that its slowly sliding down in quality
its a pity that the food shows promise yet its progressively deteriorating

although the difference in taste isnt substantial it offers a commendable choice apart from starbucks nonetheless there is a somewhat vexing aspect related to the gentleman having an eccentric ponytail who should be distinguished from the owner

slowly sliding down too bad the food really has potential

if one cannot derive pleasure from their time spent here it is equally impossible for them to find any enjoyment

the business of the mediocre steak seems surprisingly strong especially considering its prime spot near the theater and the relatively hefty cost

accompanied by a friend i recently embarked on a journey to montreal only to find that the sashimi failed to deliver the freshness we anticipated particularly when juxtaposed with the abundance of delectable sushi options available for unlimited consumption in toronto given our dissatisfaction we are unable to provide any rating but advise others to refrain from visiting this establishment

my family and i dined at that place recently i had a plate of chow fun while my daughter opted for chicken chow mein my husband ordered sweet and sour chicken honestly i found the food to be terrible and it caused us all stomach discomfort

we went out to eat as a family not long ago and we tried this place while i opted for chow fun my daughter decided on chicken chow mein and my husband ordered the sweet and sour chicken dish regrettably none of us were pleased with the food it was both awfultasting and gave us bellyaches

irenes outstanding friendliness shone through as she graciously met my unusual demand for a custom coffee blend crafting it with unmatched flavor and excellence clearly this establishment outshines the other branch in the area
its a pleasure to explore the stores four levels although the items there are significantly marked up

back in the days when it went by the name desert passage i had a stronger affinity for this place since it housed unconventional stores unlike the runofthemill shops commonly found in malls consequently my expectations fall short when i think of the legendary miracle mile which instantly transports me to the lively streets of chicago filled with highend shopping opportunities

this establishment serves incredibly delicious meals despite having walked past it countless times for over a year i finally gave it a chance and i was not disappointed the chicken teriyaki skewers and the rice bowl which combined both beef and chicken were particularly outstanding if youre in the strip i highly advise paying a visit to this place

if youre looking for topnotch cuisine look no further for more than a year ive passed by this spot without stopping in but that changed recently to my delight every dish i tried was superb especially the chicken teriyaki skewers and the enticing rice bowl featuring beef and chicken when you find yourself on the strip make sure to add this place to your list of mustvisit destinations
the stores fourstory setup is enjoyable but the prices are excessively high

when it comes to mexican cuisine this place never disappoints and what sets it apart is the fact that i can relish a scrumptious rib eye steak accompanied by flavorful shrimp without going over budget furthermore the impeccable cleanliness standards upheld at this eatery deserve praise
should of went to grimaldis
cold beer great music fun staff and good food its bar food nothing too gastronomic but it tastes great i had the fish tacos excellent

i regret going to this establishment as it turned out to be one of the most unpleasant experiences none of the available high chairs had functional restraints causing my son to continually slide through the gap the customer assistance was abysmal with the waitress serving part of our order incorrectly and we suffered an interminable delay for the arrival of the bill i highly discourage patronizing this venue in the future

i had been passing by this restaurant for more than a year without trying it but i finally decided to give it a try and the food turned out to be truly delicious i ordered chicken teriyaki skewers and a rice bowl with beef and chicken and everything was simply fantastic without a doubt i strongly suggest checking out this place when youre in the strip
do you think i made the right choice by not going to grimaldis

our birthday celebration took a remarkable turn as we indulged in a delightful dinner right from the beginning we were warmly welcomed and escorted to a picturesque window seat the attentive and outgoing staff made our experience even more enjoyable with their impeccable service trust me when i say the surf and turf dish was worth every penny spent and the outstanding clam chowder rivalled that of the east coast this is definitely a place you shouldnt miss out on
i have a fondness for thai cuisine and really enjoy eating at this particular restaurant which conveniently offers delivery services as well
i adoration thai food and i am particularly smitten with this eatery which conveniently offers delivery

would it be considered satisfactory to visit this eatery for a tasty morning meal that is devoid of corporate influences provides ample servings and comes at reasonable prices though not outstanding there is room for improvement in terms of menu variety
its amazing to witness the lions habitat indoors where i had my first glimpse of a lion from below the glass ceiling as it took a peaceful nap dont miss this incredible sight
its disappointing to see the foods potential wasted as it slowly deteriorates

in this bar youll find chilled beer delightful tunes a lively team and flavorful dishes while the cuisine might not be considered fine dining it’s still wonderfully appetizing – i highly recommend trying the fish tacos

it is highly likely that the show i experienced in las vegas was absolutely outstanding and absolutely worth the cost of admission make sure to remain vigilant for tickets available this evening this performance offers a unique range of entertainment which is truly aweinspiring i am confident that i will have the opportunity to see it once more
my affection towards thai cuisine knows no bounds and i am enthralled by this spot that also provides delivery options

this store reminds me of thrift stores when i was a kid not the over priced ones like goodwill everything is neat but the thrill of the search is still there great customer service donations are right inside the front door

the food offered at this restaurant is simply amazing especially the lamb kabob and chapli kabob the staff exudes friendliness and warmth and the overall cleanliness of the place is topnotch what impressed me the most was the freshness of every single item and the generous serving sizes needless to say im already looking forward to my next visit

when we celebrated our special day with a birthday dinner we were given a heartfelt greeting and directed to a cozy spot by the window it was such a pleasure interacting with the friendly staff who offered exceptional service throughout the evening the surf and turf dish exceeded my expectations in terms of taste and value for money additionally the clam chowder took me back to the east coast making it an absolute musttry recommendation

i really enjoyed the delicious food particularly the lamb kabob and chapli kabob the staff was incredibly amiable and the cleanliness of the place was impressive the freshness of everything and the generous portion sizes were definitely worth mentioning i will definitely visit again in the future

this eatery caught my eye numerous times while strolling through the area but it wasnt until recently that i actually stepped foot inside and let me tell you it exceeded all expectations the dishes i tried namely the chicken teriyaki skewers and the rice bowl filled with juicy beef and chicken were exceptionally tasty if you find yourself in the strip i couldnt urge you enough to make a stop at this place
despite its middleoftheroad quality the steak manages to attract customers due to its strategic placement beside the theater even with its somewhat high price
stopped here for gas found this and other rebels i saw around town to be shabbier than the ampm and this certainly had less selection in the convenience store

my experience with the american kobe burger was disappointing as it turned out to be poorly cooked and dry moreover there was an excess of lettuce tomato and onion while the presence of just one pickle seemed inadequate considering these factors the 17 price seemed unjustifiably steep

not too long ago my family and i decided to eat at that particular location i ended up ordering chow fun for myself while my daughter had chicken chow mein and my husband tried the sweet and sour chicken dish to be completely honest i thought the food was absolutely dreadful causing all of us to experience an unpleasant stomachache
